value.title: Data densification in Power Query/ Power BI
value.excerpt: Data densification is basically a technique to densify the dataset or in simpler terms, increase the number of observations in the dataset.   If you want to learn how to do that in Power BI or Power Query, check this video!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/apLS6KhTJC4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dataflows and power query - November 2020 update
value.excerpt: Have you seen the new and upcoming features released on November 2020 for Dataflows and Power Query? In today's video, I will go through them so you stay up to date:  00:00 Intro 00:24 New Diagram view 01:36 New schema view 02:16 Add column from example  02:20 Add web from example 03:13 Fuzzy grouping

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE.  I have covered ISINSCOPE before with a more difficult example, so I hope this video will explain it in easier terms and with a useful example.  Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #121: Why you should avoid bi-directional relationships
value.excerpt: In this video, I am going to show you a trick on how to avoid bidirectional relationships in your model, even when you are a beginner. value.title: DAX Fridays! #122: DAX Variables deep dive
value.excerpt: Lets do a deep dive into variables shall we? In this video, I am going to cover the following: 1. Naming variables, dos and donts 2. The syntax for calling variables 3. value.title: DAX FRIDAYS! #178 : My age calculations in DAX and Power Query are wrong!! How do I do it?
value.excerpt: Calculating age is harder that you think, both in power query and dax.  In today's video, I am going to show you two ways to do it with DAX  and power query that get the closest to the actual age.  Do you know any other method to calculate age? Share it in the comments!
